verses.verse: Then Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite <WH8489> answered <WH6030> and said, <WH559>
If we assay <WH5254> to commune <WH1697> with you, will you be grieved? <WH3811> but who <WH4310> can <WH3201> withhold <WH6113> himself from speaking? <WH4405>
Behold, <WH2009> you have instructed <WH3256> many, <WH7227> and you have strengthened <WH2388> the weak <WH7504> hands. <WH3027>
Your words <WH4405> have upheld <WH6965> him that was falling, <WH3782> and you have strengthened <WH553> the feeble <WH3766> knees. <WH1290>
But now <WH6258> it is come <WH935> on you, and you faint; <WH3811> it touches <WH5060> you, and you are troubled. <WH926>
Is not this your fear, <WH3374> your confidence, <WH3690> your hope, <WH8615> and the uprightness <WH8537> of your ways? <WH1870>
Remember, <WH2142> I pray <WH4994> you, who <WH4310> ever perished, <WH6> being innocent? <WH5355> or where <WH375> were the righteous <WH6662> cut <WH3582> off?
Even as I have seen, <WH7200> they that plow <WH2790> iniquity, <WH205> and sow <WH2232> wickedness, <WH5999> reap <WH7114> the same.
By the blast <WH5397> of God <WH433> they perish, <WH6> and by the breath <WH7307> of his nostrils <WH639> are they consumed. <WH3615>
The roaring <WH7581> of the lion, <WH738> and the voice <WH6963> of the fierce <WH7826> lion, <WH7826> and the teeth <WH8127> of the young <WH3715> lions, <WH3715> are broken. <WH5421>
The old lion <WH3918> perishes <WH6> for lack <WH1097> of prey, <WH2964> and the stout lion's <WH3833> whelps <WH1121> are scattered <WH6504> abroad. <WH6504>
Now a thing <WH1697> was secretly <WH1589> brought <WH1589> to me, and my ear <WH241> received <WH3947> a little <WH8102> thereof.
In thoughts <WH5587> from the visions <WH2384> of the night, <WH3915> when deep <WH8639> sleep <WH8639> falls <WH5307> on <WH5921> men, <WH582>
Fear <WH6343> came <WH7122> on me, and trembling, <WH7460> which made all <WH7230> my bones <WH6106> to shake. <WH6342>
Then a spirit <WH7307> passed <WH2498> before <WH5921> my face; <WH6440> the hair <WH8185> of my flesh <WH1320> stood <WH5568> up:

It stood <WH5975> still, but I could not discern <WH5234> the form <WH4758> thereof: an image <WH8544> was before <WH5048> my eyes, <WH5869> there was silence, <WH1827> and I heard <WH8085> a voice, <WH6963> saying,
Shall mortal <WH582> man <WH582> be more just <WH6663> than God? <WH433> shall a man <WH1400> be more pure <WH2891> than his maker? <WH6213>
Behold, <WH2005> he put no <WH3808> trust <WH539> in his servants; <WH5650> and his angels <WH4397> he charged <WH7760> with folly: <WH8417>

How <WH637> much <WH637> less in them that dwell <WH7931> in houses <WH1004> of clay, <WH2563> whose <WH834> foundation <WH3247> is in the dust, <WH6083> which are crushed <WH1792> before <WH6440> the moth? <WH6211>
They are destroyed <WH3807> from morning <WH1242> to evening: <WH6153> they perish <WH6> for ever <WH5331> without any regarding <WH7760> it.
Does not their excellency <WH3499> which is in them go <WH5265> away? <WH5265> they die, <WH4191> even without <WH3808> wisdom. <WH2451>
